Epitaph: Beloved husband and father, faithful servant of the church
Notes: John Miller was a miller by trade, owning the local watermill. He served as church warden for 20 years.

Epitaph: In memory of a devoted wife and mother, her kindness remembered
Notes: Mary Miller (n√©e Smith) was known for her charitable works in the parish. She outlived her husband by 10 years.

Epitaph: A life of service to his community, taken too soon
Notes: Thomas Miller inherited the family mill. He was a town councillor and contributed to the restoration of the church roof.

Epitaph: A noble patron of this church, his memory endures in stained glass
Notes: Sir Reginald Blackwood funded the installation of the east window stained glass in 1810. He was a local landowner and magistrate.

Epitaph: Beloved wife and mother, her gentleness touched all who knew her
Notes: Lady Eleanor Blackwood was a noted philanthropist, establishing a school for girls in the parish.
